item.title: Google Finds Data Theft Malware Used by Russian APT in Select Cases
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Russia-linked APT Star Blizzard is using the ClickFix technique in recent attacks distributing the LostKeys malware.

The post Google Finds Data Theft Malware Used by Russian APT in Select Cases appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Improperly Patched Samsung MagicINFO Vulnerability Exploited by Botnet
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The patches for an exploited Samsung MagicINFO vulnerability are ineffective and a Mirai botnet has started targeting it.

The post Improperly Patched Samsung MagicINFO Vulnerability Exploited by Botnet appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Cisco Patches 35 Vulnerabilities Across Several Products
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Cisco releases patches for 26 vulnerabilities in IOS and IOS XE software, including 17 critical- and high-severity bugs.

The post Cisco Patches 35 Vulnerabilities Across Several Products appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Dozens of SysAid Instances Vulnerable to Remote Hacking
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
SysAid patches IT service management software vulnerabilities that can be chained for unauthenticated remote command execution. 

The post Dozens of SysAid Instances Vulnerable to Remote Hacking appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Masimo Manufacturing Facilities Hit by Cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Health technology and consumer electronics firm Masimo detected unauthorized activity on its network in late April.

The post Masimo Manufacturing Facilities Hit by Cyberattack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Cisco’s Quantum Bet: Linking Small Machines Into One Giant Quantum Computer
item.dc:creator: Kevin Townsend
item.description:
Cisco unveils its Quantum Network Entanglement Chip and new Quantum Labs, laying the groundwork for a scalable quantum internet that connects distributed quantum computers into a unified, powerful system.

The post Cisco’s Quantum Bet: Linking Small Machines Into One Giant Quantum Computer appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: CodeAnt AI Raises $2 Million for Code Quality and Application Security Platform
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Code quality and security firm CodeAnt has secured $2 million in seed funding and it has been valued at $20 million.

The post CodeAnt AI Raises $2 Million for Code Quality and Application Security Platform  appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: CrowdStrike Plans Layoffs to Pursue $10B ARR Target
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
CrowdStrike said the planned cuts will affect approximately 500 employees and will span the first half of fiscal 2026.

The post CrowdStrike Plans Layoffs to Pursue $10B ARR Target appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Ox Security Bags $60M Series B to Tackle Appsec Alert Fatigue
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
Ox Security has raised a total $94 million since its launch in 2021 with ambitious plans to cash in on two fast-moving trends.

The post Ox Security Bags $60M Series B to Tackle Appsec Alert Fatigue  appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: New UK Framework Pressures Vendors on SBOMs, Patching and Default MFA
item.dc:creator: Ryan Naraine
item.description:
By baking minimum expectations into procurement conversations, the plan is to steer software vendors to “secure-by-design and default” basics.

The post New UK Framework Pressures Vendors on SBOMs, Patching and Default MFA appeared first on SecurityWeek.
